intro: Leutea gracillima, commonly known as the slender leutea, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are elongated and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Leutea gracillima is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
